alert.note: Alert for Porter (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 4:47AM EDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Porter County through 415 AM CDT... At 347 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspout over Lake Michigan 7 miles north of Porter, or 10 miles north of Chesterton, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Chesterton, Porter, Town of Pines, Beverly Shores and Dune Acres. Including the following interstates... Indiana I-90 between mile markers 32 and 36. Indiana I-94 between mile markers 24 and 32. This includes... Indiana Dunes State and National Park. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
